question.question_subtype: Select One or More Answer Choices
question.stimulus: This is a stimulus for a test
question.question_stem:
The writer of the following sentence deleted the mention of her uncle as she revised because this information was __________ to the main idea of her essay.

When I was only sixteen, I left home to attend a college in California that my uncle had graduated from twenty years earlier.

explanations.A: Incorrect. 'Critical' implies that the information is very important, which is not the case here.
explanations.B: Incorrect. 'Incidental' suggests the information is minor but still related, while it's stated as irrelevant.
explanations.C: Correct! The mention of the uncle is irrelevant to the main idea of the essay, so the writer deleted it.
explanations.D: Incorrect. 'Necessary' would imply that the information was essential, which contradicts the revision described.

question_details.learning_outcome: Students will understand the importance of maintaining focus on the main idea when revising an essay.
question_details.learning_objective: This question assesses the ability to identify irrelevant information in an essay and understand the revision process.
